com.foodbook.foodbook
Class RecipeBook

java.lang.Object
  com.foodbook.foodbook.RecipeBook
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class RecipeBook
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

RecipeBook is a collection of local and downloaded recipes.

This class is the centre of the Model. It has the collection of local (and downloaded) recipes, and class methods associated with it.

Author:
Jaeseo Park (jaeseo1), Jasmine Woo (jwoo), Nhu Bui (nbui), Robert Janes (rjanes)
See Also:
Recipe, Serialized Form

getRecipeBook

public java.util.ArrayList<Recipe> getRecipeBook()
This is a getter for the entire RecipeBook. Since there are two recipe books ("mine" and "downloaded"), this method will simply combine them and return the resulting array.

Returns:
List of downloaded and local Recipes

formatStringArrayListEntries

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> formatStringArrayListEntries(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> input)
This methods is used to modify existing recipes in the recipe book. Given the details about the recipe and the recipe ID, this method will apply changes.

Parameters:
recipename - name of recipe
recipeDescriptions - description of recipe
recipeinstructions - recipe instructions
ingredients - list of ingredients
category - genre

updateAuthorInAllRecipes

public void updateAuthorInAllRecipes()
Upon change of author (username), this method will go through each recipe in "mine" array, and will update "author" field.
